page.title: 04OLD BUILDINGS NEAR GRANTOWN
page.content:
HISTORIC BUILDINGS
The oldest building in the area is Castle Grant, a building which dates form medievil times and is the home of the clan Grant. As with most castles it has been extended and changed periodically. Today it is being restored and several rooms are open to the public.
The town of Grantown-on-Spey contains many buildings of a later vintage, which are worthy of note. The town was planned around a green, known as the Square. A wide, tree-lined road splits the square. Most of the buildings are of granite, including Speyside House, which is capped by a cupola containing a clock, erected at the time of the Napoleonic wars.
